raw_text:
The One in Barbados: Part 2
Written by: Brian Buckner and Sebastian Jones   Directed by: Roger Christiansen
Transcribed by: Ane B. J.
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
(Ross and Rachel enter)
Rachel: Hi!
Ross: Hey! So what's the big news you had us rush all the   way over here for?
Chandler: Okay, our news. My company has asked me to head   up our office in Tulsa , so as of Monday I'm being officially relocated.
Ross: Oh my God!
Phoebe: What?!
Rachel: What?!
Ross: Monday?!
Joey: How long do you have to go for?
Chandler: They said it could be up to a year.
Joey: A year?!
Rachel: (To Monica) Do you have to go?
Monica: I kind of have to don't I? Because of this stupid   thing (Points to her wedding ring.)
Chandler: There is nothing like the support of your loving   wife, huh?
Joey: Wait a minute, you can't go to Tulsa. Maybe you forgot,   but we've got tickets to the Jets game next week.
Chandler: I'm sorry buddy, but I don't think I'm gonna be   able to make it.
Joey: We were gonna go see the Jets!
Ross: You can't go, I mean you're the glue that holds this   group together!
Chandler: Really?
Ross: Not you.
Joey: I can't believe you guys are moving.
Phoebe: I call their apartment!!!
Everyone: No!!! Ah!! Ahh!!! 
 [INTRO]
[Scene: Central Perk]
Joey: Here you are (Hands Rachel a cup of coffee)
Rachel: Thank you Joey. You know what? I'm not even sure   I can have caffeine.
Ross: I went thru this with Ben and Carol. One cup of coffee   won't affect your milk.
Rachel: Yeah. Just to be sure I'm gonna call Dr. Wiener. 
Joey: (Laughs)
Rachel: Every time? (She takes up her cell phone and starts   dialing.)
Joey: Uhuh.
Ross: Rach, you don't have to call whenever you have a little   question, okay? Trust me, I know this.
Rachel: All right, I trust you. (Continues to dial)
Ross: Rachel, I can see you dialing! I don't understand why...
Rachel: I'm on the phone! (On the phone) Dr. Wiener? (Ross   and Rachel walk away)
Joey: (Laughs)
Phoebe: It's so weird seeing Ross and Rachel with a baby.   It's just so grown up.
Joey: I know, yeah. I feel like we're all growing up. Person   named Wiener, God that kills me. (Laughs)
Phoebe: Look at you all grown up.
Joey: Actually, you know what? I am. That whole thing with   Rachel made me realize that maybe I'm ready for a more serious relationship.   You know? Like I'd like to meet a nice mature commitment-minded lady. And looks   aren't as important as...Nah, she's gotta be hot.
Phoebe: You know, I might know somebody. Hey, how about you   set me up with someone, and we double date!
Joey: I can do that, yeah. How is Friday?
Phoebe: Done. Oh good, really?
Joey: Yeah! 
Phoebe: Let's see! (Opens her address book.) Oh, you know   who's great? Sandy Poophack. 
Joey: (Laughs) Poophack... (Laughs)
Phoebe: Yeah... All right, well that rules out Lana Titweiller
Joey: (Laughs)
[SCENE: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
Chandler: (Enters) Hey!
Monica: Hey!
Chandler: I've got good news!
Monica: You got out of the whole Tulsa thing?
Chandler: Okay, I have news. You don't have to move to Tulsa.   You can stay here and keep your job. 
Monica: It's great! How?
Chandler. Well my boss and I worked out a deal where I only   have to be in Tulsa four days a week, so the other three I can be here with   you.
Monica: So you're gonna be gone four days a week? (Thinks   about it.) No.
Chandler: I'm sorry, are you just used to saying that?
Monica: No. I can't be away from you for that long.
Chandler: Really?
Monica: Yeah, you're my husband. I'm not gonna live in a   different state than you for 208 days out of the year.
Chandler: That's fast math! We could use you in Tulsa. 
Monica: Honey, thanks for trying to figure out a way, but   if you're going to Tulsa, I wanna go with you.
Chandler: Hey, you said that without gagging!
Monica: I know! (They high-five.) 
[Scene: Ross and Rachel's apartment]
Rachel: (On the phone) Excuse me? Oh yeah? Well, up yours too! (Hangs up)
Ross: (Enters from his bedroom)Who the hell was that?!
Rachel: Dr. Wiener. 
Ross: Rach, you can't call people at three in the morning. 
Rachel: Oh you know what, you sound just like his wife!
Ross: Was there anything you did wrong with Emma?
Rachel: Yes, of course there is! Okay? I'm not insane!
Ross: Well, what was it?
Rachel: Hiccups.
Ross: Rach, I told you, you can't call him every time any   little thing comes up. 
Rachel: Yeah well, not anymore I can't. He fired us! What   are we gonna do? We have to find a pediatrician. Wait wait, Monica said that   when you guys were growing up, you really liked your doctor. What was his name?
Ross: Dr. Gettleman? Yeah I know, I don't think that's a   good idea. In fact, I think he's dead.
Rachel: Argh! Why does everything happen to me?!
Ross: Rach, I promise first thing tomorrow we'll find another   doctor, but I gotta get up early and I'm not feeling all that well.
Rachel: What? What, do you mean you're not feeling well?   What do you have? Is it Rubella? Because don't go near Emma, she has not had   that shot.
Ross: You know? Come to think of it, it does feel Rubella-like!   (Walks back into his room.)
Rachel: (Grabs the phone and stars dialing) (On phone) (In   a high pitch voice) Wiener, Wiener (In a low pitch voice) Wiener, Wiener!!!
Ross: (Comes back into the living room) Rachel!!!
Rachel: Great! Now he's gonna know it was me!
[Scene: Joey's apartment]
Phoebe: (Enters) Hey!
Joey: Hey!
Phoebe: So how is this for our big double date tonight? (She   is all dressed up)
Joey: (Realizes that he has forgotten all about the double   date) Oh my God!
Phoebe: Ooh, great! Just the reaction I was hoping for. 
Joey: Yeah, so you found someone for me. You didn't forget? 
Phoebe: Of course not! And you're gonna love Mary Ellen.   She's really smart and cute and funny, and I can't tell you how I know this,   but she' not opposed to threesomes. So tell me some about my guy. 
Joey: No.
Phoebe: Come on, give me something. What's his name?
Joey: Mike.
Phoebe: Mike? Okay! What's his last name?
Joey: Damnit! Is there no mystery left in romance anymore!?
Phoebe: All right, we'll se you and Mike at the restaurant   in a couple hours.
Joey and Phoebe: (Ad-lib good-byes) (Phoebe leaves)
Joey: Why did I have to say Mike? I don't know a Mike! Why   couldn't I have said... (Looks through his address book) There's no guy in   there! 
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
Rachel: It's impossible to find a good doctor. I mean, how   do you know the good ones from the ones who are gonna push their penis against   your knee?
Monica: Excuse me?
Chandler: I know what she's talking about.
Rachel: We've got to find a new pediatrician. Ross was getting   sick last night, and I think Emma may have caught it.
Monica: Why don't you go see Dr. Gettleman? 
Rachel: Ross said he died. 
Monica: He didn't die. I saw his daughter last week. Said   he was fine. Her on the other hand, botched Botox.
Rachel: Oh, great! Well, then I'm gonna take Emma to see   him. I wonder why Ross said that he died.
Monica: Oh, maybe he was getting him confused with his childhood   therapist.
Chandler: He saw a therapist?
Monica: Yeah, he used to have this recurring nightmare, just   really freaked him out.
Rachel: Why? What was it?
Monica: That I was going to eat him.
[Scene: Central Perk]
 (Joey walks in and looks around. He's trying to find a Mike for Phoebe)
Joey: MIKE!!!
Mike: Yeah? 
Joey: (Checks him out) Okay! (Walks over to his table and   sits down with him)
[Scene: Restaurant]
Mike: I gotta tell you, I can't believe I'm doing this with   you. Although I did just get out of a nine-year relationship, so I guess I   should be open and taking some risks.
Joey: Everything is gonna be fine. Just follow my lead, okay?   All you have to do is pretend to be Mike.
Mike: I am Mike.
Joey: Atta boy!
 (Phoebe and Mary Ellen enter.)
Joey: Okay, look...
Everyone: (Ad-lib hellos)
Phoebe: Joey, this is Mary Ellen Jenkins. So, Mike, how do   you and Joey know each other anyway?
Mike: How do I and Joey know each other? Wow, if I had a   nickel for every time somebody has asked me that.
Joey: (Laughs) From school.
Mike: Yeah, we met in college. (Off Joey's look) I mean,   high school.
Phoebe: Wow, you guys go way back then. So what are you up   to these days?
Mike: Well, I'm a lawyer.
Joey: Mike, 'attorney at law'!
Mike: Actually, I just gave up my practice.
Joey: What? That's the kinda thing you usually run by me.
Mike: I always wanted to play piano professionally, and I   figured if I don't do this now, I never will.
Phoebe: Wow, that's great! I liked that better than the law   thing, so...
Joey: Which is why I waited until now to introduce you to   Mike.
Mary Ellen: I thought you thought he was still a lawyer.
Joey: No, no, that's not what I meant. Let's get you a cocktail.
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
 (Monica Enters. Chandler is in the kitchen with his laptop)
Monica: Hey!
Chandler: Hey!
Monica: What are you doing?
Chandler: Looking for restaurant jobs for you in Tulsa.
Monica: That's so sweet. Find anything?
Chandler: Slim Pickings.
Monica: Nothing, huh?
Chandler: No, 'Slim Pickings', it's a barbecue restaurant.   They're looking for a cook. Actually 'cook' may be a bit of a stretch. They're   looking for someone to shovel mesquite. 
Monica: 'Slim Pickings'...That is so cheesy.
Chandler: 'So Cheesy' also has an opening.
Monica: Honey, that's okay. I actually know this woman, Nancy,   who's a restaurant biz head-hunter. Maybe she'll know of something.
Chandler: Can I just say how much I appreciate you coming   with me. When we get to Tulsa I'm taking you for a great dinner at 'Slim Pickings'.   'So Cheesy'? 'Whole Hog'? It's going to be tough to keep Kosher in Tulsa.
Monica: (On phone) Hi, Nancy. Hi, it's Monica Geller. I'm   good. Listen, I'm looking for a job in Tulsa. Well yeah, my husband has been   relocated...Because I love him! No, I don't want a job in New York. Javo (sp?)   is looking? Oh my God! He asked for me personally? Oh my God! Oh, wow, this   is really flattering, but I'm moving to Tulsa. Yeah, so if you would tell Javo   (sp?) 'I'll take it!'
[Scene: Pediatrician's office]
Rachel: Hi, my name is Rachel Green, I have an appointment   for Emma.
Receptionist: Dr. Gettleman is finishing up with a patient,   he should be out shortly.
Dr. Gettleman: (To a patient) I think you just have a cold,   it's definitely not Strep.
Ross: Thanks doctor.
Dr. Gettleman: Would you like a lollypop?
Ross: You even have to ask?! (He grabs a lollypop out of   a jar) (Sees Rachel) (To Rachel) He is alive!
[Scene: Restaurant]
Phoebe: You know, it's so surprising that you and Joey have   known each other for so long and I've never heard about you.
Joey: Yeah, that's because we had a bit of a falling out.   Mike hit my mom with a car.
Mike: No, I didn't.
Joey: That's okay Mike, I have forgiven you. And now we're   friends again everything's great!
Mary Ellen Wait, is your mom okay?
Joey: Please, we're trying to have a conversation. (Pushes   the wine glass closer to Mary Ellen.)
Mary Ellen: Wow, you're a lot nicer on 'Days of Our Lives'.
Mike: 'Days of Our Lives'! That's why you look so familiar!
Phoebe: What?!
Mike: What?!
Joey: What?!
Phoebe: Do you not know each other?
Joey: (Laughs) Of course we do! Mike is playing a game that   we used to play in high school. Yeah, where we pretend we don't know each other.   We played all kinds of games. (To Mike) Hey, remember the one where I punch   you in the face for not being cool?!
Phoebe: Mike, let me ask you something. How many sisters   does Joey have?
Mike: (Joey holds up six fingers) Six!
Joey: What are you doing? I said seven! (Holds up six fingers.)   (Realizes his mistake) Argh!!!
Phoebe: Joey, why did you set me up with a stranger?
Joey: Because I forgot about our date, I'm so sorry.
Mike: I'm sorry too. And just to be clear, I didn't hit his   mother with a car.
Phoebe: (To Joey) You are unbelievable! I spent so much time   finding the perfect girl for you, you know. Mary Ellen is really smart and   cute and loose.
Mary Ellen: Hey!
Phoebe: Who are you kidding? (To Joey) You just find some   guy off the street for me? Oh God! This is humiliating!
Joey: Look Phoebe I'm so sorry! Hey, look, if you don't like   this guy I can find you a better one. (Looks around) Mike!! Mike!!
Phoebe: I'm out of here (She leaves)
Mike: It was nice meeting you!
Joey: (To Mary Ellen) You're leaving too?
Mary Ellen: I'll stay if you can tell me my name.
Joey: Good night! 
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
Chandler: Honey, we're leaving tomorrow you've still got   a lot of packing to do.
Monica: You're right. (Pause) Maybe I shouldn't go.
Chandler: What?
Monica: So Nancy told me about this job at this great restaurant,   Javo (sp?). It's just a little outside of Tulsa.
Chandler: How far outside?
Monica: Manhattan.
Chandler: And you're thinking of taking it? (Pause) So before   you said being me with me was more important than any job, but I guess now   it's old job, (Raises his hand) me, (Raises his hand) new job. 
Monica: I'm gonna miss this hand! Okay I know it's a lot   to ask, but oh my God Chandler, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity.
Chandler: What happened to 'you can't live without me four   days a week'?
Monica: Well, if you really think about it, I mean four days   is not that long. I mean, I see you Monday before you go to work, and I see   you Thursday when you get back, and I always work late on Tuesdays, so really   if you think about it, it's really just one day. And well, if we can't make   it one day, we've got real problems my friend.
Chandler: I think you should take the job.
Monica: Really?
Chandler: Yeah. I know it must be important to you when you   start chattering like a monkey.
Monica: That's the nicest anyone has ever said to me!
 (Ross and Rachel enter with Emma.)
Ross: Hey!
Monica: How was the pediatrician?
Rachel: Oh, I really liked him. (Looks at Ross) Yeah, it   was really, really, really good.
Ross: You promised you wouldn't say anything.
Rachel: I know. (Pause) Ross still sees his pediatrician!!!   (To Ross) I don't care!
Monica: Are you serious? You still see Dr. Gettleman?
Ross: He's a brilliant diagnostician!
Chandler: Diagnostician or boo-boo fixer?
Rachel: Ross, seriously! You've gotta go to an appropriate   doctor.
Ross: Why? Why? I know it's a little weird, but hey, he's   a great doctor, okay? He knows my medical history, and every time I go in there,   he makes a big deal. 'Ah look, it's my favorite patient!'
Chandler: Does he say that before he sticks his thermometer   in your touchy?
Ross: Hey, I seem to remember someone bringing his security   blanket to college!
Chandler: That was not a security blanket! That was a wall-hanging!
Ross: It didn't spend much time on the wall!!!
[Scene: Central Perk]
Mike: Excuse me, hi. I was hoping I would run into you. Can   we talk?
Phoebe: Sure.
Mike: I'm sorry, really, I'm so embarrassed. Really, I'm   a pretty nice guy. Just ask my parole officer...Apparently I'm not a funny   guy.
Phoebe: Why did you go along with that?
Mike: Because I was told I'd get a free dinner, which I didn't.   And that I'd meet a pretty girl. Which I did.
Phoebe: That's true. (Pause) Well, is anything you told me   about yourself true?
Mike: My name in Mike, and I do play piano.
Phoebe: Prove it.
Mike: There isn't a piano here.
Phoebe: That wouldn't stand in the way of a true pianist.
Mike: (Plays 'air piano')
Phoebe: You are really good! I play a little guitar myself.
Mike: Really?
Phoebe: Uhuh.
Mike: That's great. What kind of music do you play?
Phoebe: Well, like acoustic folksy stuff. You know? But right   now I'm working on a couple 'Iron Maiden' covers. 
Mike: Do you think that maybe, sometime, I could...
Phoebe: It's okay. Go ahead, ask me out.
Mike: Okay. Do you think maybe sometime I could take you   out?
Joey: (Walks In)
Phoebe: (To Mike) Oh, you just caught me off guard! Yeah,   that would be nice.
Joey: Look at this. My two best friends!
 (Phoebe and Mike look at him, and he goes over to the counter.)
[Scene: Pediatrician's office]
Ross: Excuse me, I don't mean to be a jerk, but the baby   with the rash came in after me.
Receptionist: The doctor will be right with you sir.
Girl: (Reading a book) Mommy, I can't find Waldo.
Ross: With the circus? He's behind the elephant.
Woman: Wow, so your child is a big fan of the Waldo books   too?
Ross: Yeah, that's how I know. I'm Ross by the way.
Sally: Hi, I'm Sally. So, no ring. Can I assume you are also   a single parent?
Ross: I am a single parent.
Sally: It's hard isn't it? There's almost no time for a social   life. I mean, where are you gonna meet someone?
Ross: Well, let's say, I don't know, you met someone in the   pediatrician's office.
Nurse: (To Ross) Rossy, we're ready for you.
Ross: Hmm, yeah. (To a random boy in the waiting room) Come   on Ross jr. It's time to go in.
Boy: Mommy (He walks over to Sally.)
Girl: Mommy, what's wrong with that man?
Ross: Hey, I helped you find Waldo! 
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
Ross: (Enters) Oh good, you haven't left yet.
Monica: Where have you been?
Ross: I got held up at Dr. Gettleman's office. There was   some guy that freaked everybody out.
Chandler: Well, you got here just in time. I really have   to go buddy. (They hug)
Ross: Oh man.
Monica: Promise to call me when you land.
Chandler: Of course I will call you. I love you.
Monica: I love you too. (They kiss)
Rachel: Okay, wow, wow, wow. Watch the tongue people, we've   got a baby over here.
Phoebe: Bye Chandler.
Chandler: Awww. (They hug) Bye!
Rachel: Bye honey. (They hug)
Chandler: (Tries to hug Joey but J. moves away) What's the   matter Joe?
Joey: I'm mad at you for leaving! You're nothing but a big   leaver. Big leaver with a stupid suitcase.
Chandler: Any chance you are trying to pick a fight to make   all this easier?
Joey: Dude, you see right thru me!! (They hug) (Joey heads   for the door and pushes Chandler's suitcase on the way out.)
Chandler: Well, bye Mon, bye Ross, Rachel, bye Emma!
Phoebe: Okay, bye-bye! (Pushes Chandler out the door.) Good   trip! (Slams the door)
Monica: (Runs out to the hallway) Chandler, wait. It goes:   Old job, (Raises her hand) new job, (Raises her hand really high) you. This   is just something I have to do.
Chandler: I know.
Monica: I love you so much.
Chandler: I know that too. (They kiss)
 (Joey opens the door and takes Chandler's suitcase into his own apartment.)
[Scene: Airport]
Chandler: (On cell phone) Don't worry, I'll be back before   you know it. Yes it will be the same. Because I know, that's how. I promise.
CUT TO: Monica and Chandler's apartment.
Joey: (On the phone with Chandler) Double promise? Call me   when you land.
Monica: Can I talk now?
Joey: Okay, bye. (He hangs up the phone.)
Monica: Joey?
Joey: He had to board.

lines.speaker: The One in Barbados
lines.text: Part 2

lines.speaker: Written by
lines.text: Brian Buckner and Sebastian Jones   Directed by: Roger Christiansen

lines.speaker: Transcribed by
lines.text: Ane B. J.
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
(Ross and Rachel enter)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey! So what's the big news you had us rush all the   way over here for?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Okay, our news. My company has asked me to head   up our office in Tulsa , so as of Monday I'm being officially relocated.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Monday?!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: How long do you have to go for?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: They said it could be up to a year.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: A year?!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (To Monica) Do you have to go?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I kind of have to don't I? Because of this stupid   thing (Points to her wedding ring.)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: There is nothing like the support of your loving   wife, huh?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Wait a minute, you can't go to Tulsa. Maybe you forgot,   but we've got tickets to the Jets game next week.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I'm sorry buddy, but I don't think I'm gonna be   able to make it.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: We were gonna go see the Jets!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You can't go, I mean you're the glue that holds this   group together!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Not you.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I can't believe you guys are moving.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I call their apartment!!!

lines.speaker: Everyone
lines.text: No!!! Ah!! Ahh!!!
[INTRO]
[Scene: Central Perk]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Here you are (Hands Rachel a cup of coffee)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Thank you Joey. You know what? I'm not even sure   I can have caffeine.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I went thru this with Ben and Carol. One cup of coffee   won't affect your milk.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah. Just to be sure I'm gonna call Dr. Wiener.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Laughs)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Every time? (She takes up her cell phone and starts   dialing.)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Uhuh.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Rach, you don't have to call whenever you have a little   question, okay? Trust me, I know this.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: All right, I trust you. (Continues to dial)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Rachel, I can see you dialing! I don't understand why...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I'm on the phone! (On the phone) Dr. Wiener? (Ross   and Rachel walk away)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Laughs)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: It's so weird seeing Ross and Rachel with a baby.   It's just so grown up.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I know, yeah. I feel like we're all growing up. Person   named Wiener, God that kills me. (Laughs)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Look at you all grown up.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Actually, you know what? I am. That whole thing with   Rachel made me realize that maybe I'm ready for a more serious relationship.   You know? Like I'd like to meet a nice mature commitment-minded lady. And looks   aren't as important as...Nah, she's gotta be hot.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You know, I might know somebody. Hey, how about you   set me up with someone, and we double date!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I can do that, yeah. How is Friday?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Done. Oh good, really?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Let's see! (Opens her address book.) Oh, you know   who's great? Sandy Poophack.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Laughs) Poophack... (Laughs)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah... All right, well that rules out Lana Titweiller

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Laughs)
[SCENE: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (Enters) Hey!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I've got good news!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You got out of the whole Tulsa thing?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Okay, I have news. You don't have to move to Tulsa.   You can stay here and keep your job.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: It's great! How?
Chandler. Well my boss and I worked out a deal where I only   have to be in Tulsa four days a week, so the other three I can be here with   you.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: So you're gonna be gone four days a week? (Thinks   about it.) No.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I'm sorry, are you just used to saying that?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No. I can't be away from you for that long.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah, you're my husband. I'm not gonna live in a   different state than you for 208 days out of the year.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: That's fast math! We could use you in Tulsa.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Honey, thanks for trying to figure out a way, but   if you're going to Tulsa, I wanna go with you.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hey, you said that without gagging!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I know! (They high-five.)
[Scene: Ross and Rachel's apartment]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (On the phone) Excuse me? Oh yeah? Well, up yours too! (Hangs up)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (Enters from his bedroom)Who the hell was that?!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Dr. Wiener.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Rach, you can't call people at three in the morning.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh you know what, you sound just like his wife!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Was there anything you did wrong with Emma?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yes, of course there is! Okay? I'm not insane!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well, what was it?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hiccups.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Rach, I told you, you can't call him every time any   little thing comes up.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah well, not anymore I can't. He fired us! What   are we gonna do? We have to find a pediatrician. Wait wait, Monica said that   when you guys were growing up, you really liked your doctor. What was his name?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Dr. Gettleman? Yeah I know, I don't think that's a   good idea. In fact, I think he's dead.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Argh! Why does everything happen to me?!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Rach, I promise first thing tomorrow we'll find another   doctor, but I gotta get up early and I'm not feeling all that well.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What? What, do you mean you're not feeling well?   What do you have? Is it Rubella? Because don't go near Emma, she has not had   that shot.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know? Come to think of it, it does feel Rubella-like!   (Walks back into his room.)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (Grabs the phone and stars dialing) (On phone) (In   a high pitch voice) Wiener, Wiener (In a low pitch voice) Wiener, Wiener!!!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (Comes back into the living room) Rachel!!!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Great! Now he's gonna know it was me!
[Scene: Joey's apartment]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (Enters) Hey!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: So how is this for our big double date tonight? (She   is all dressed up)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Realizes that he has forgotten all about the double   date) Oh my God!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, great! Just the reaction I was hoping for.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah, so you found someone for me. You didn't forget?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Of course not! And you're gonna love Mary Ellen.   She's really smart and cute and funny, and I can't tell you how I know this,   but she' not opposed to threesomes. So tell me some about my guy.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Come on, give me something. What's his name?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Mike.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Mike? Okay! What's his last name?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Damnit! Is there no mystery left in romance anymore!?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: All right, we'll se you and Mike at the restaurant   in a couple hours.

lines.speaker: Joey and Phoebe
lines.text: (Ad-lib good-byes) (Phoebe leaves)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Why did I have to say Mike? I don't know a Mike! Why   couldn't I have said... (Looks through his address book) There's no guy in   there!
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: It's impossible to find a good doctor. I mean, how   do you know the good ones from the ones who are gonna push their penis against   your knee?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I know what she's talking about.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: We've got to find a new pediatrician. Ross was getting   sick last night, and I think Emma may have caught it.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Why don't you go see Dr. Gettleman?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ross said he died.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: He didn't die. I saw his daughter last week. Said   he was fine. Her on the other hand, botched Botox.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, great! Well, then I'm gonna take Emma to see   him. I wonder why Ross said that he died.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, maybe he was getting him confused with his childhood   therapist.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: He saw a therapist?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah, he used to have this recurring nightmare, just   really freaked him out.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Why? What was it?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: That I was going to eat him.
[Scene: Central Perk]
(Joey walks in and looks around. He's trying to find a Mike for Phoebe)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: MIKE!!!

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Checks him out) Okay! (Walks over to his table and   sits down with him)
[Scene: Restaurant]

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I gotta tell you, I can't believe I'm doing this with   you. Although I did just get out of a nine-year relationship, so I guess I   should be open and taking some risks.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Everything is gonna be fine. Just follow my lead, okay?   All you have to do is pretend to be Mike.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I am Mike.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Atta boy!
(Phoebe and Mary Ellen enter.)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Okay, look...

lines.speaker: Everyone
lines.text: (Ad-lib hellos)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Joey, this is Mary Ellen Jenkins. So, Mike, how do   you and Joey know each other anyway?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: How do I and Joey know each other? Wow, if I had a   nickel for every time somebody has asked me that.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Laughs) From school.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Yeah, we met in college. (Off Joey's look) I mean,   high school.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Wow, you guys go way back then. So what are you up   to these days?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Well, I'm a lawyer.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Mike, 'attorney at law'!

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Actually, I just gave up my practice.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What? That's the kinda thing you usually run by me.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I always wanted to play piano professionally, and I   figured if I don't do this now, I never will.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Wow, that's great! I liked that better than the law   thing, so...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Which is why I waited until now to introduce you to   Mike.

lines.speaker: Mary Ellen
lines.text: I thought you thought he was still a lawyer.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: No, no, that's not what I meant. Let's get you a cocktail.
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
(Monica Enters. Chandler is in the kitchen with his laptop)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Looking for restaurant jobs for you in Tulsa.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: That's so sweet. Find anything?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Slim Pickings.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Nothing, huh?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: No, 'Slim Pickings', it's a barbecue restaurant.   They're looking for a cook. Actually 'cook' may be a bit of a stretch. They're   looking for someone to shovel mesquite.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: 'Slim Pickings'...That is so cheesy.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: 'So Cheesy' also has an opening.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Honey, that's okay. I actually know this woman, Nancy,   who's a restaurant biz head-hunter. Maybe she'll know of something.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Can I just say how much I appreciate you coming   with me. When we get to Tulsa I'm taking you for a great dinner at 'Slim Pickings'.   'So Cheesy'? 'Whole Hog'? It's going to be tough to keep Kosher in Tulsa.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (On phone) Hi, Nancy. Hi, it's Monica Geller. I'm   good. Listen, I'm looking for a job in Tulsa. Well yeah, my husband has been   relocated...Because I love him! No, I don't want a job in New York. Javo (sp?)   is looking? Oh my God! He asked for me personally? Oh my God! Oh, wow, this   is really flattering, but I'm moving to Tulsa. Yeah, so if you would tell Javo   (sp?) 'I'll take it!'
[Scene: Pediatrician's office]

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi, my name is Rachel Green, I have an appointment   for Emma.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: Dr. Gettleman is finishing up with a patient,   he should be out shortly.
Dr. Gettleman: (To a patient) I think you just have a cold,   it's definitely not Strep.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Thanks doctor.
Dr. Gettleman: Would you like a lollypop?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You even have to ask?! (He grabs a lollypop out of   a jar) (Sees Rachel) (To Rachel) He is alive!
[Scene: Restaurant]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You know, it's so surprising that you and Joey have   known each other for so long and I've never heard about you.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah, that's because we had a bit of a falling out.   Mike hit my mom with a car.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: No, I didn't.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: That's okay Mike, I have forgiven you. And now we're   friends again everything's great!
Mary Ellen Wait, is your mom okay?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Please, we're trying to have a conversation. (Pushes   the wine glass closer to Mary Ellen.)

lines.speaker: Mary Ellen
lines.text: Wow, you're a lot nicer on 'Days of Our Lives'.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: 'Days of Our Lives'! That's why you look so familiar!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Do you not know each other?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Laughs) Of course we do! Mike is playing a game that   we used to play in high school. Yeah, where we pretend we don't know each other.   We played all kinds of games. (To Mike) Hey, remember the one where I punch   you in the face for not being cool?!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Mike, let me ask you something. How many sisters   does Joey have?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: (Joey holds up six fingers) Six!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What are you doing? I said seven! (Holds up six fingers.)   (Realizes his mistake) Argh!!!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Joey, why did you set me up with a stranger?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Because I forgot about our date, I'm so sorry.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I'm sorry too. And just to be clear, I didn't hit his   mother with a car.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (To Joey) You are unbelievable! I spent so much time   finding the perfect girl for you, you know. Mary Ellen is really smart and   cute and loose.

lines.speaker: Mary Ellen
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Who are you kidding? (To Joey) You just find some   guy off the street for me? Oh God! This is humiliating!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Look Phoebe I'm so sorry! Hey, look, if you don't like   this guy I can find you a better one. (Looks around) Mike!! Mike!!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: I'm out of here (She leaves)

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: It was nice meeting you!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (To Mary Ellen) You're leaving too?

lines.speaker: Mary Ellen
lines.text: I'll stay if you can tell me my name.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Good night!
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Honey, we're leaving tomorrow you've still got   a lot of packing to do.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You're right. (Pause) Maybe I shouldn't go.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: So Nancy told me about this job at this great restaurant,   Javo (sp?). It's just a little outside of Tulsa.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: How far outside?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Manhattan.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: And you're thinking of taking it? (Pause) So before   you said being me with me was more important than any job, but I guess now   it's old job, (Raises his hand) me, (Raises his hand) new job.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm gonna miss this hand! Okay I know it's a lot   to ask, but oh my God Chandler, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What happened to 'you can't live without me four   days a week'?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Well, if you really think about it, I mean four days   is not that long. I mean, I see you Monday before you go to work, and I see   you Thursday when you get back, and I always work late on Tuesdays, so really   if you think about it, it's really just one day. And well, if we can't make   it one day, we've got real problems my friend.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I think you should take the job.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah. I know it must be important to you when you   start chattering like a monkey.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: That's the nicest anyone has ever said to me!
(Ross and Rachel enter with Emma.)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: How was the pediatrician?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, I really liked him. (Looks at Ross) Yeah, it   was really, really, really good.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You promised you wouldn't say anything.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I know. (Pause) Ross still sees his pediatrician!!!   (To Ross) I don't care!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Are you serious? You still see Dr. Gettleman?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: He's a brilliant diagnostician!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Diagnostician or boo-boo fixer?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ross, seriously! You've gotta go to an appropriate   doctor.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Why? Why? I know it's a little weird, but hey, he's   a great doctor, okay? He knows my medical history, and every time I go in there,   he makes a big deal. 'Ah look, it's my favorite patient!'

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Does he say that before he sticks his thermometer   in your touchy?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey, I seem to remember someone bringing his security   blanket to college!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: That was not a security blanket! That was a wall-hanging!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: It didn't spend much time on the wall!!!
[Scene: Central Perk]

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Excuse me, hi. I was hoping I would run into you. Can   we talk?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I'm sorry, really, I'm so embarrassed. Really, I'm   a pretty nice guy. Just ask my parole officer...Apparently I'm not a funny   guy.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Why did you go along with that?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Because I was told I'd get a free dinner, which I didn't.   And that I'd meet a pretty girl. Which I did.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: That's true. (Pause) Well, is anything you told me   about yourself true?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: My name in Mike, and I do play piano.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Prove it.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: There isn't a piano here.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: That wouldn't stand in the way of a true pianist.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: (Plays 'air piano')

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You are really good! I play a little guitar myself.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Uhuh.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: That's great. What kind of music do you play?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, like acoustic folksy stuff. You know? But right   now I'm working on a couple 'Iron Maiden' covers.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Do you think that maybe, sometime, I could...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: It's okay. Go ahead, ask me out.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Okay. Do you think maybe sometime I could take you   out?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (Walks In)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (To Mike) Oh, you just caught me off guard! Yeah,   that would be nice.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Look at this. My two best friends!
(Phoebe and Mike look at him, and he goes over to the counter.)
[Scene: Pediatrician's office]

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Excuse me, I don't mean to be a jerk, but the baby   with the rash came in after me.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.text: The doctor will be right with you sir.

lines.speaker: Girl
lines.text: (Reading a book) Mommy, I can't find Waldo.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: With the circus? He's behind the elephant.

lines.speaker: Woman
lines.text: Wow, so your child is a big fan of the Waldo books   too?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, that's how I know. I'm Ross by the way.

lines.speaker: Sally
lines.text: Hi, I'm Sally. So, no ring. Can I assume you are also   a single parent?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I am a single parent.

lines.speaker: Sally
lines.text: It's hard isn't it? There's almost no time for a social   life. I mean, where are you gonna meet someone?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well, let's say, I don't know, you met someone in the   pediatrician's office.

lines.speaker: Nurse
lines.text: (To Ross) Rossy, we're ready for you.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hmm, yeah. (To a random boy in the waiting room) Come   on Ross jr. It's time to go in.

lines.speaker: Boy
lines.text: Mommy (He walks over to Sally.)

lines.speaker: Girl
lines.text: Mommy, what's wrong with that man?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey, I helped you find Waldo!
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (Enters) Oh good, you haven't left yet.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Where have you been?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I got held up at Dr. Gettleman's office. There was   some guy that freaked everybody out.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well, you got here just in time. I really have   to go buddy. (They hug)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Promise to call me when you land.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Of course I will call you. I love you.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I love you too. (They kiss)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay, wow, wow, wow. Watch the tongue people, we've   got a baby over here.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Bye Chandler.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Awww. (They hug) Bye!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Bye honey. (They hug)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (Tries to hug Joey but J. moves away) What's the   matter Joe?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I'm mad at you for leaving! You're nothing but a big   leaver. Big leaver with a stupid suitcase.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Any chance you are trying to pick a fight to make   all this easier?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Dude, you see right thru me!! (They hug) (Joey heads   for the door and pushes Chandler's suitcase on the way out.)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Well, bye Mon, bye Ross, Rachel, bye Emma!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Okay, bye-bye! (Pushes Chandler out the door.) Good   trip! (Slams the door)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (Runs out to the hallway) Chandler, wait. It goes:   Old job, (Raises her hand) new job, (Raises her hand really high) you. This   is just something I have to do.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I love you so much.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I know that too. (They kiss)
(Joey opens the door and takes Chandler's suitcase into his own apartment.)
[Scene: Airport]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (On cell phone) Don't worry, I'll be back before   you know it. Yes it will be the same. Because I know, that's how. I promise.

lines.speaker: CUT TO
lines.text: Monica and Chandler's apartment.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (On the phone with Chandler) Double promise? Call me   when you land.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Can I talk now?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Okay, bye. (He hangs up the phone.)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Joey?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: He had to board.
